body_content.explanation: one of the small forts (= military buildings designed to be defended against attack) that were built around the coasts of the British Isles during the wars against Napoleon in the 19th century, and at other times in certain other countries:
examples: Dymchurch has its own Martello tower in the centre of the town, built to protect against Napoleonic invasion.
He lives in a converted Martello Tower on the Suffolk coast.
